title: A question i have not seen asked before
body:
How does a homeless child living on the streets of Zaun with no access to a lab or expensive materials create a device like the Z drive? {{champion:245}}
-Edit- sorry, haven't really actually read his lore. I now understand he is not homeless thank you for the replies, but the question still remains. xD

replies.body: Well, we have 13 and 14 year olds in our world who build nuclear fusion reactors in their parents sheds and garages.  So with (as GreenLore and Legacy of Xion have mentioned) the advantage of having a home and well-meaning parents, it seems highly impressive, but not impossible, that a kid like Ekko could make something amazing using the bits and parts that could be found in Zaun.

Wait what? We don't even have controlled nuclear fusion IRL with governments and stuff. I can imagine a kid knowing how to make a fission reactor, but not having the materials. Please, if I'm wrong I want to know cause that is pretty awesome if true.

Edit: I just looked into it, technically at least one youngster has created a device to fuse to atoms together, and the young man was successful. It was a little more involved than just a garage project in the case I found, and required a few thousand dollars in specific equipment and materials that was paid for by his school (hmm maybe Ekko got a grant in the same way). Definitely cool, but not the controlled fusion humanity is searching for, and thank goodness it was extremely low energy and boring (cause yeah, the sun is a big fusion reactor and it's scary).

I don't know for certain (I'm not privy to that information) but I'd err on the side of them not being directly related.  Quite a few people wondered if the Gambler in the recent River King video was Twisted Fate, for example, but Jaredan has stated that the urge to always have champions related to each other makes the world seem a bit small.  It might be far too much of a coincidence if they were father and son.

Here's [Jaredan talking about the (very tempting) urge to have new champs be really closely connected](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/story-art/khkWEbWQ-what-the-hell-is-the-lore-team-getting-paid-for?comment=005b0000000000050000), from the outset, to other existing champs.  Note that he's all about champs having stories together _later_ (and the interesting things that come out of that) but maybe not at the start.

But like I said - I don't know for certain.  I'm not on that team.
They said there was no relation in the Q&A.

> [{quoted}](name=Solideus,realm=EUNE,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=7jmmYyww,comment-id=0003000100000000,timestamp=2015-06-23T15:22:07.236+0000)
>

Huh!  [You're right!](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/xEVZQjPL?comment=019b0000)  I should have read that more closely so I didn't talk nonsense.  My apologies, and props to Solideus for keeping me right.

I understand Jaredan's counterurge to clamp down on the they're-related urge, but as we're going on 127 champions, my inclination is that the world will feel plenty big no matter how tightly they're woven together.  Just my $0.02.
Thank you :)
